value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

relationships.name: failure

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: bootstrap.servers

value.description: The name of the Kafka Topic
value.name: topic

value.description: String value uniquely identifying this client application. Corresponds to Kafka's 'client.id' property.
value.name: client.id

allowableValues.description: PLAINTEXT
SSL
SASL_PLAINTEXT
SASL_SSL

value.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.
value.name: security.protocol

value.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.It is ignored unless one of the SASL options of the <Security Protocol> are selected.
value.name: sasl.kerberos.service.name

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka. Corresponds to Kafka's 'acks' property.
value.name: acks

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: kafka-key

value.description: Specifies the string (interpreted as UTF-8) to use for demarcating apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. To enter special character such as 'new line' use CTRL+Enter or Shift+Enter depending on your OS.
value.name: message-demarcator

value.description: The amount of time KafkaConsumer will wait to obtain metadata during the 'send' call before failing the entire 'send' call. Corresponds to Kafka's 'max.block.ms' property
value.name: max.block.ms

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.

value.description: Specifies which class to use to compute a partition id for a message. Corresponds to Kafka's 'partitioner.class' property.
value.name: partitioner.class

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: compression.type

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are the are successfully sent to or received from Kafka are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

processGroups.name: Simulator - (REFREASON) Send Messages to Kafka Topics

processGroups.comments:
Transformator for DATACONFIRM subject. It consists of several processors grouped with the aims of reformat the CSV tables into JSON records and split them into individual JSON object. It also includes removing null values, mapping some values according to client's recommendation, and removing unnecessary fields.
For the sake of simulating them, they will be put into the hard disk before being transferred to Kafka.

value.description: A JsonPath expression that indicates the array element to split into JSON/scalar fragments.
value.name: JsonPath Expression

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON or the specified path does not exist), it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that was split into segments. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: All segments of the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: split

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

value.description: If the Avro records do not contain the schema (datum only), it must be specified here.
value.name: Avro schema

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.name: Destination

value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of Hadoop configuration files
value.name: Hadoop configuration files

value.description: Outgoing Avro schema for each record created from a CSV row
value.name: Record schema

value.description: Character set for CSV files
value.name: CSV charset

value.description: Delimiter character for CSV records
value.name: CSV delimiter

value.description: Quote character for CSV values
value.name: CSV quote character

value.description: Escape character for CSV values
value.name: CSV escape character

value.description: Whether to use the first line as a header
value.name: Use CSV header line

value.description: Number of lines to skip before reading header or data
value.name: Lines to skip

relationships.description: CSV content that could not be processed
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: CSV content that could not be converted
relationships.name: incompatible

relationships.description: Avro content that was converted successfully from CSV
relationships.name: success

value.description: Control if Avro schema is written as a new flowfile attribute 'inferred.avro.schema' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Schema Output Destination

value.description: Content Type of data present in the incoming FlowFile's content. Only "json" or "csv" are supported. If this value is set to "use mime.type value" the incoming Flowfile's attribute "MIME_TYPE" will be used to determine the Content Type.
value.name: Input Content Type

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Comma separated string defining the column names expected in the CSV data. EX: "fname,lname,zip,address". The elements present in this string should be in the same order as the underlying data. Setting this property will cause the value of "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" to be ignored instead using this value.
value.name: CSV Header Definition

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. If "true" the processor will attempt to read the CSV header definition from the first line of the input data.
value.displayName: Get CSV Header Definition From Data
value.name: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Specifies the number of lines that should be skipped when reading the CSV data. Setting this value to 0 is equivalent to saying "the entire contents of the file should be read". If the property "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" is set then the first line of the CSV file will be read in and treated as the CSV header definition. Since this will remove the header line from the data care should be taken to make sure the value of "CSV header Line Skip Count" is set to 0 to ensure no data is skipped.

processGroups.name: Simulator - (DATACONFIRM) Convert and Split CSV to JSON files

processGroups.comments:
Transformator for REFROOM subject. It consists of several processors grouped with the aims of reformat the CSV tables into JSON records and split them into individual JSON object. It also includes removing null values, mapping some values according to client's recommendation, and removing unnecessary fields.
For the sake of simulating them, they will be put into the hard disk before being transferred to Kafka.

value.description: A JsonPath expression that indicates the array element to split into JSON/scalar fragments.
value.name: JsonPath Expression

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON or the specified path does not exist), it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that was split into segments. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: All segments of the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: split

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

relationships.description: Failed to convert attributes to JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

value.description: If the Avro records do not contain the schema (datum only), it must be specified here.
value.name: Avro schema

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

processGroups.name: Simulator - (DATAATTEND) Convert and Split CSV to JSON files

processGroups.comments:
Transformator for REFSITE subject. It consists of several processors grouped with the aims of reformat the CSV tables into JSON records and split them into individual JSON object. It also includes removing null values, mapping some values according to client's recommendation, and removing unnecessary fields.
For the sake of simulating them, they will be put into the hard disk before being transferred to Kafka.

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Control if Avro schema is written as a new flowfile attribute 'inferred.avro.schema' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Schema Output Destination

value.description: Content Type of data present in the incoming FlowFile's content. Only "json" or "csv" are supported. If this value is set to "use mime.type value" the incoming Flowfile's attribute "MIME_TYPE" will be used to determine the Content Type.
value.name: Input Content Type

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Comma separated string defining the column names expected in the CSV data. EX: "fname,lname,zip,address". The elements present in this string should be in the same order as the underlying data. Setting this property will cause the value of "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" to be ignored instead using this value.
value.name: CSV Header Definition

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. If "true" the processor will attempt to read the CSV header definition from the first line of the input data.
value.displayName: Get CSV Header Definition From Data
value.name: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Specifies the number of lines that should be skipped when reading the CSV data. Setting this value to 0 is equivalent to saying "the entire contents of the file should be read". If the property "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" is set then the first line of the CSV file will be read in and treated as the CSV header definition. Since this will remove the header line from the data care should be taken to make sure the value of "CSV header Line Skip Count" is set to 0 to ensure no data is skipped.
value.name: CSV Header Line Skip Count

value.description: Delimiter character for CSV records
value.name: CSV delimiter

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. String that represents an escape sequence in the CSV FlowFile content data.
value.name: CSV Escape String

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. String that represents a literal quote character in the CSV FlowFile content data.
value.name: CSV Quote String

value.description: If true the Avro output will be formatted.
value.name: Pretty Avro Output

value.description: Value to be placed in the Avro record schema "name" field.
value.name: Avro Record Name

value.description: This property only applies to JSON content type. The number of JSON records that should be examined to determine the Avro schema. The higher the value the better chance kite has of detecting the appropriate type. However the default value of 10 is almost always enough.
value.name: Number Of Records To Analyze

value.description: Character encoding of CSV data.
value.name: Charset

value.name: security.protocol

value.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.It is ignored unless one of the SASL options of the <Security Protocol> are selected.
value.name: sasl.kerberos.service.name

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka. Corresponds to Kafka's 'acks' property.
value.name: acks

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: kafka-key

value.description: Specifies the string (interpreted as UTF-8) to use for demarcating apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. To enter special character such as 'new line' use CTRL+Enter or Shift+Enter depending on your OS.
value.name: message-demarcator

value.description: The amount of time KafkaConsumer will wait to obtain metadata during the 'send' call before failing the entire 'send' call. Corresponds to Kafka's 'max.block.ms' property
value.name: max.block.ms

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.

value.description: Specifies which class to use to compute a partition id for a message. Corresponds to Kafka's 'partitioner.class' property.

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

relationships.description: Failed to convert attributes to JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

value.description: If the Avro records do not contain the schema (datum only), it must be specified here.
value.name: Avro schema

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

processGroups.name: Simulator - (REFREASON) Convert and Split CSV to JSON files

processGroups.comments:
Transformator for REFLOCATION subject. It consists of several processors grouped with the aims of reformat the CSV tables into JSON records and split them into individual JSON object. It also includes removing null values, mapping some values according to client's recommendation, and removing unnecessary fields.
For the sake of simulating them, they will be put into the hard disk before being transferred to Kafka.

value.description: Content Type of data present in the incoming FlowFile's content. Only "json" or "csv" are supported. If this value is set to "use mime.type value" the incoming Flowfile's attribute "MIME_TYPE" will be used to determine the Content Type.
value.name: Input Content Type

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Comma separated string defining the column names expected in the CSV data. EX: "fname,lname,zip,address". The elements present in this string should be in the same order as the underlying data. Setting this property will cause the value of "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" to be ignored instead using this value.
value.name: CSV Header Definition

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. If "true" the processor will attempt to read the CSV header definition from the first line of the input data.
value.displayName: Get CSV Header Definition From Data
value.name: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Specifies the number of lines that should be skipped when reading the CSV data. Setting this value to 0 is equivalent to saying "the entire contents of the file should be read". If the property "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" is set then the first line of the CSV file will be read in and treated as the CSV header definition. Since this will remove the header line from the data care should be taken to make sure the value of "CSV header Line Skip Count" is set to 0 to ensure no data is skipped.

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

processors.name: Get CSV files (1 file per 5 mins)

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

relationships.description: Failed to convert attributes to JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON
relationships.name: success

processGroups.name: Simulator - (REFLOCATION) Convert and Split CSV to JSON files

processGroups.comments: Transporter for REFSITE subject. It transfers JSON objects from hard disk to Kafka cluster, using time interval set.

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: bootstrap.servers

value.description: The name of the Kafka Topic
value.name: topic

value.description: String value uniquely identifying this client application. Corresponds to Kafka's 'client.id' property.
value.name: client.id

allowableValues.description: PLAINTEXT
SSL
SASL_PLAINTEXT
SASL_SSL

value.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.
value.name: security.protocol

value.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.It is ignored unless one of the SASL options of the <Security Protocol> are selected.
value.name: sasl.kerberos.service.name

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka. Corresponds to Kafka's 'acks' property.
value.name: acks

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: kafka-key

value.description: Specifies the string (interpreted as UTF-8) to use for demarcating apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. To enter special character such as 'new line' use CTRL+Enter or Shift+Enter depending on your OS.
value.name: message-demarcator

value.description: The amount of time KafkaConsumer will wait to obtain metadata during the 'send' call before failing the entire 'send' call. Corresponds to Kafka's 'max.block.ms' property
value.name: max.block.ms

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.

value.description: Specifies which class to use to compute a partition id for a message. Corresponds to Kafka's 'partitioner.class' property.
value.name: partitioner.class

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: compression.type

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are the are successfully sent to or received from Kafka are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The POST URL provided by Slack to send messages into a channel.
value.name: webhook-url

value.description: The text sent in the webhook message
value.name: webhook-text

value.description: A public channel using #channel or direct message using @username. If not specified, the default webhook channel as specified in Slack's Incoming Webhooks web interface is used.
value.name: channel

value.description: The displayed Slack username
value.name: username

value.description: Icon URL to be used for the message
value.name: icon-url

value.description: Icon Emoji to be used for the message. Must begin and end with a colon, e.g. :ghost:
value.name: icon-emoji

entry.value: ${filename} failed to send to Kafka topics

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure if unable to be sent to Slack
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to success after being successfully sent to Slack
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

processGroups.name: Simulator - (REFSITE) Send Messages to Kafka Topics

processGroups.comments:
Transformator for REFEXAM subject. It consists of several processors grouped with the aims of reformat the CSV tables into JSON records and split them into individual JSON object. It also includes removing null values, mapping some values according to client's recommendation, and removing unnecessary fields.
For the sake of simulating them, they will be put into the hard disk before being transferred to Kafka.

value.description: A comma-separated list of Hadoop configuration files
value.name: Hadoop configuration files

value.description: Outgoing Avro schema for each record created from a CSV row
value.name: Record schema

value.description: Character set for CSV files
value.name: CSV charset

value.description: Delimiter character for CSV records
value.name: CSV delimiter

value.description: Quote character for CSV values
value.name: CSV quote character

value.description: Escape character for CSV values
value.name: CSV escape character

value.description: Whether to use the first line as a header
value.name: Use CSV header line

value.description: Number of lines to skip before reading header or data
value.name: Lines to skip

relationships.description: CSV content that could not be processed
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: CSV content that could not be converted
relationships.name: incompatible

relationships.description: Avro content that was converted successfully from CSV
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Control if Avro schema is written as a new flowfile attribute 'inferred.avro.schema' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Schema Output Destination

value.description: Content Type of data present in the incoming FlowFile's content. Only "json" or "csv" are supported. If this value is set to "use mime.type value" the incoming Flowfile's attribute "MIME_TYPE" will be used to determine the Content Type.
value.name: Input Content Type

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Comma separated string defining the column names expected in the CSV data. EX: "fname,lname,zip,address". The elements present in this string should be in the same order as the underlying data. Setting this property will cause the value of "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" to be ignored instead using this value.
value.name: CSV Header Definition

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. If "true" the processor will attempt to read the CSV header definition from the first line of the input data.
value.displayName: Get CSV Header Definition From Data
value.name: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Specifies the number of lines that should be skipped when reading the CSV data. Setting this value to 0 is equivalent to saying "the entire contents of the file should be read". If the property "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" is set then the first line of the CSV file will be read in and treated as the CSV header definition. Since this will remove the header line from the data care should be taken to make sure the value of "CSV header Line Skip Count" is set to 0 to ensure no data is skipped.
value.name: CSV Header Line Skip Count

value.description: Delimiter character for CSV records
value.name: CSV delimiter

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. String that represents an escape sequence in the CSV FlowFile content data.
value.name: CSV Escape String

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. String that represents a literal quote character in the CSV FlowFile content data.
value.name: CSV Quote String

value.description: If true the Avro output will be formatted.
value.name: Pretty Avro Output

value.description: Value to be placed in the Avro record schema "name" field.
value.name: Avro Record Name

value.description: This property only applies to JSON content type. The number of JSON records that should be examined to determine the Avro schema. The higher the value the better chance kite has of detecting the appropriate type. However the default value of 10 is almost always enough.
value.name: Number Of Records To Analyze

value.description: Character encoding of CSV data.
value.name: Charset

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

value.description: If the Avro records do not contain the schema (datum only), it must be specified here.

relationships.name: failure

relationships.name: success

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.

processGroups.name: Simulator - (REFEXAM) Convert and Split CSV to JSON files

processGroups.comments:
Transformator for REFSPECIALTY subject. It consists of several processors grouped with the aims of reformat the CSV tables into JSON records and split them into individual JSON object. It also includes removing null values, mapping some values according to client's recommendation, and removing unnecessary fields.
For the sake of simulating them, they will be put into the hard disk before being transferred to Kafka.

value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

processors.name: Get CSV files (1 file per 5 mins)

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: A comma-separated list of Hadoop configuration files
value.name: Hadoop configuration files

value.description: Outgoing Avro schema for each record created from a CSV row
value.name: Record schema

value.description: Character set for CSV files
value.name: CSV charset

value.description: Delimiter character for CSV records
value.name: CSV delimiter

value.description: Quote character for CSV values
value.name: CSV quote character

value.description: Escape character for CSV values
value.name: CSV escape character

value.description: Whether to use the first line as a header
value.name: Use CSV header line

value.description: Number of lines to skip before reading header or data
value.name: Lines to skip

relationships.description: CSV content that could not be processed
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: CSV content that could not be converted
relationships.name: incompatible

relationships.description: Avro content that was converted successfully from CSV
relationships.name: success

value.description: Control if Avro schema is written as a new flowfile attribute 'inferred.avro.schema' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Schema Output Destination

value.description: Content Type of data present in the incoming FlowFile's content. Only "json" or "csv" are supported. If this value is set to "use mime.type value" the incoming Flowfile's attribute "MIME_TYPE" will be used to determine the Content Type.
value.name: Input Content Type

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Comma separated string defining the column names expected in the CSV data. EX: "fname,lname,zip,address". The elements present in this string should be in the same order as the underlying data. Setting this property will cause the value of "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" to be ignored instead using this value.
value.name: CSV Header Definition

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. If "true" the processor will attempt to read the CSV header definition from the first line of the input data.
value.displayName: Get CSV Header Definition From Data
value.name: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. Specifies the number of lines that should be skipped when reading the CSV data. Setting this value to 0 is equivalent to saying "the entire contents of the file should be read". If the property "Get CSV Header Definition From Data" is set then the first line of the CSV file will be read in and treated as the CSV header definition. Since this will remove the header line from the data care should be taken to make sure the value of "CSV header Line Skip Count" is set to 0 to ensure no data is skipped.
value.name: CSV Header Line Skip Count

value.description: Delimiter character for CSV records
value.name: CSV delimiter

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. String that represents an escape sequence in the CSV FlowFile content data.
value.name: CSV Escape String

value.description: This property only applies to CSV content type. String that represents a literal quote character in the CSV FlowFile content data.
value.name: CSV Quote String

value.description: If true the Avro output will be formatted.
value.name: Pretty Avro Output

value.description: Value to be placed in the Avro record schema "name" field.
value.name: Avro Record Name

value.description: This property only applies to JSON content type. The number of JSON records that should be examined to determine the Avro schema. The higher the value the better chance kite has of detecting the appropriate type. However the default value of 10 is almost always enough.
value.name: Number Of Records To Analyze

value.description: Character encoding of CSV data.
value.name: Charset

entry.key: Get CSV Header Definition From Data

relationships.description: Failed to create Avro schema from data.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Original incoming FlowFile data
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: Successfully created Avro schema from data.
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: The content found in the flowfile content is not of the required format.
relationships.name: unsupported content

value.description: A JsonPath expression that indicates the array element to split into JSON/scalar fragments.
value.name: JsonPath Expression

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON or the specified path does not exist), it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that was split into segments. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: All segments of the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: split

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

value.description: If the Avro records do not contain the schema (datum only), it must be specified here.
value.name: Avro schema

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: bootstrap.servers

value.description: The name of the Kafka Topic
value.name: topic

value.description: String value uniquely identifying this client application. Corresponds to Kafka's 'client.id' property.
value.name: client.id

allowableValues.description: PLAINTEXT
SSL
SASL_PLAINTEXT
SASL_SSL

value.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.
value.name: security.protocol

value.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.It is ignored unless one of the SASL options of the <Security Protocol> are selected.
value.name: sasl.kerberos.service.name

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka. Corresponds to Kafka's 'acks' property.
value.name: acks

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: kafka-key

value.description: Specifies the string (interpreted as UTF-8) to use for demarcating apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. To enter special character such as 'new line' use CTRL+Enter or Shift+Enter depending on your OS.
value.name: message-demarcator

value.description: The amount of time KafkaConsumer will wait to obtain metadata during the 'send' call before failing the entire 'send' call. Corresponds to Kafka's 'max.block.ms' property
value.name: max.block.ms

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.

value.description: Specifies which class to use to compute a partition id for a message. Corresponds to Kafka's 'partitioner.class' property.
value.name: partitioner.class

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: compression.type

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are the are successfully sent to or received from Kafka are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

value.description: The amount of time KafkaConsumer will wait to obtain metadata during the 'send' call before failing the entire 'send' call. Corresponds to Kafka's 'max.block.ms' property
value.name: max.block.ms

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.

value.description: Specifies which class to use to compute a partition id for a message. Corresponds to Kafka's 'partitioner.class' property.
value.name: partitioner.class

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: compression.type

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are the are successfully sent to or received from Kafka are routed to this relationship

processGroups.name: Simulator - (REFEXAM) Send Messages to Kafka Topics

processGroups.comments: Transporter for DATAEXAM subject. It transfers JSON objects from hard disk to Kafka cluster, using time interval set.

value.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be included in the resulting JSON. If this value is left empty then all existing Attributes will be included. This list of attributes is case sensitive. If an attribute specified in the list is not found it will be be emitted to the resulting JSON with an empty string or NULL value.
value.name: Attributes List

value.description: Control if JSON value is written as a new flowfile attribute 'JSONAttributes' or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Determines if the FlowFile org.apache.nifi.flowfile.attributes.CoreAttributes which are contained in every FlowFile should be included in the final JSON value generated.
value.name: Include Core Attributes

value.description: If true a non existing or empty attribute will be NULL in the resulting JSON. If false an empty string will be placed in the JSON
value.name: Null Value

relationships.description: Failed to convert attributes to JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully converted attributes to JSON
relationships.name: success

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

processors.name: Get JSON Files (1 msg per 1 sec)

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: bootstrap.servers

value.description: The name of the Kafka Topic
value.name: topic

value.description: String value uniquely identifying this client application. Corresponds to Kafka's 'client.id' property.
value.name: client.id

allowableValues.description: PLAINTEXT
SSL
SASL_PLAINTEXT
SASL_SSL

value.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.
value.name: security.protocol

value.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.It is ignored unless one of the SASL options of the <Security Protocol> are selected.
value.name: sasl.kerberos.service.name

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka. Corresponds to Kafka's 'acks' property.
value.name: acks

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: kafka-key

value.description: Specifies the string (interpreted as UTF-8) to use for demarcating apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. To enter special character such as 'new line' use CTRL+Enter or Shift+Enter depending on your OS.

value.description: The amount of time KafkaConsumer will wait to obtain metadata during the 'send' call before failing the entire 'send' call. Corresponds to Kafka's 'max.block.ms' property
value.name: max.block.ms

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.

processGroups.comments:
Since datasets provided for the experiment is in CSV format and also due to our VM resource limitations, we consider breaking down those files into smaller sized CSV tables with 10,000 records per each.
Each CSV files will be transferred to corresponding folders on the hard disk after the process, to enter the simulation phase.

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file, excluding header lines. A value of zero requires Maximum Fragment Size to be set, and line count will not be considered in determining splits.
value.name: Line Split Count

value.description: The maximum size of each split file, including header lines. NOTE: in the case where a single line exceeds this property (including headers, if applicable), that line will be output in a split of its own which exceeds this Maximum Fragment Size setting.
value.name: Maximum Fragment Size

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: The first character(s) on the line of the datafile which signifies a header line. This value is ignored when Header Line Count is non-zero. The first line not containing the Header Line Marker Characters and all subsequent lines are considered non-header
value.name: Header Line Marker Characters

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later. If this is set to 'true' and a FlowFile is generated that contains only 'empty lines' (i.e., consists only of and characters), the FlowFile will not be emitted. Note, however, that if header lines are specified, the resultant FlowFile will never be empty as it will consist of the header lines, so a FlowFile may be emitted that contains only the header lines.
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
